Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh is in the fourth position in Group 2 with one win and one loss.
Star all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan has scored just 8 runs in two matches so far and the team's top scorer is Liton Das who has scored 43 runs in two matches.
Bangladesh bowlers have also not done very well. Taskin Ahmed is the team's top wicket-taker, taking five wickets in two matches, but in the meantime, he has leaked runs at an economy of 10.14.
Zimbabwe is going to take the field after registering a blistering win over Pakistan by one run.
Sikandar Raza has been the show-down man for the team and has performed remarkably well with both bat and ball. Raza has scored 145 runs in 5 matches.
Wesley Madhevere has added 101 runs, and Craig Ervine has scored 88 runs in 4 matches. The rest of the batters have given mixed performances.
Sikandar Raza has taken 8 wickets in the tournament and is the leading wicket-taker for Zimbabwe.
